subject: Re: [junit] Looking for some "Best Practices"
msgSnippet: ... IDEA 3.0 was released last week or the week before, and it allows multiple class templates. For anyone who has only tried version 2.6, I d suggest getting
messageBody:
On Sun, 24 Nov 2002, Steve Freeman wrote:
> Bill de h√ìra wrote:
> >>This will be no exception, then :) IntelliJ IDEA has two kinds of
> >>templates, both of which could be useful for generating test cases. One
> >>type is a template for new files,
> > Last time I looked IntelliJ only allowed one class template (which
> > isn't enough!).
>
> no longer true, at least in the early adopters edition.

IDEA 3.0 was released last week or the week before, and it allows multiple
class templates. For anyone who has only tried version 2.6, I'd suggest
getting an evaluation version of 3.0 and playing around with it for a
while. It has huge number of improvements. Unfortunatley, the price has
gone up a lot too. (It's $500, or $700 if you want free upgrades for a
year, up from $400 with free upgrades for 8 months.)


Erik
